title: SANDWORM DEATH
desc: You have been killed by a <font=text_4m>sandworm</>. All items in your inventory have been lost and are not recoverable.
Stick to rocky ground to avoid the sandworm's attention or use a vehicle to travel quickly across the open sands.

title: SANDWORM THREAT
desc: This bar in the center of the screen shows the <font=text_4m>vibrations</> you are making on open sand -- vibrations will attract the <font=text_4m>Sandworms</>. When the vibration bar <font=text_4m>turns red</>, seek safety immediately--the sandworm is nearby.
The closer a worm is, the more sensitive it is to vibrations. Take the utmost care crossing the open desert!

title: DEATH
desc: Arrakis is an unforgiving world, and <font=text_4m>death</> here is costly. Items in your backpack can be recovered from your death location.
You will lose everything if you are killed by a <font=text_4m>Sandworm</> or <font=text_4m>Coriolis Storm</>.

title: FINDING WATER
desc: You need to <font=text_4m>hydrate</>.
You can partially replenish your hydration level by drinking <font=text_4m>Dew</> from <font=text_4m>Dew Flowers</>.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/E> [Hold] Drink

title: WATER DISCIPLINE
desc: Having your <font=text_4m>Hydration Level</> above one-third will give you a bonus to your maximum stamina, which is further increased above two-thirds.

When your hydration is below one-third, the bonus to your maximum stamina is removed -- when it is empty, you become <font=text_4m>Dehydrated</> and you will start to lose health until you hydrate again.

title: DRINKING BLOOD
desc: Blood can be consumed to hydrate yourself.

title: SUNSTROKE
desc: Spending time in the sun will fill up the sunstroke bar. Once filled you will be affected by <font=text_4m>Sunstroke</> which increases dehydration rate.
To avoid and remove <font=text_4m>Sunstroke</>, stick to the shadows.

title: SHELTER
desc: <font=text_4m>Sheltered areas</> provide protection from <font=text_4m>Sandstorms</>. Seek them out to avoid one of the key dangers of Arrakis.
Your shelter status is displayed above the <font=text_4m>Hydration Bar</>.

title: CUTTERAY
desc: The <font=text_4m>Cutteray</> is used for mining resources.
The <font=text_4m>Analysis Mode</> displays hidden <font=text_4m>structural weaknesses</> that can be traced with the Cutteray laser to yield greater resource amounts.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/RMB:1.7:1> Analysis Mode
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/LMB:1.7:1> Fire Cutteray<gap=.5>

title: CUTTERAY DOORS
desc: The <font=text_4m>Cutteray</> can scan and cut open certain doors.
Use <font=text_4m>Analysis Mode</> to reveal hidden <font=text_4m>structural weaknesses</>, then trace them with the laser to breach the door.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/RMB:1.7:1> Analysis Mode
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/LMB:1.7:1> Fire Cutteray<gap=.5>

title: SUB-FIEF CONSOLE
desc: The Sub-Fief Console is the control center of a base and where you manage player <font=text_4m>permissions</>, <font=text_4m>storage</> and <font=text_4m>power distribution</>.
<font=text_4m>Landclaim</> is an area around the sub-fief console. This area defines where you can build.
Change the <font=text_4m>elevation</> and <font=text_4m>rotation</> of the Sub-Fief Console by following the commands at the right hand side of the screen.

title: FILLING PROJECTIONS
desc: A projection acts as representation of what you want to build and is only visible while the construction tool is equipped.
Any player in your team can see and fill projections.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/LMB:1.7:1> Place projection
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/LMB:1.7:1> Hold to place and fill projection<gap=.5>

title: CONSTRUCTION MODES
desc: The <font=text_4m>Construction Tool</> features several <font=text_4m>Modes</> that you can swap between.
These modes are Build, Piece Picker, Repair. Move, and Demolish.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/RMB:1.7:1> Swap Tool Mode

title: BASE MANAGEMENT
desc: Permissions are managed via the <font=text_4m>Sub-Fief Console</>.
Add players to the permission list, and assign their <font=text_4m>Permission level</>.
Set <font=text_4m>Access Levels</> on interactables (doors machines, etc.). Players can only use an object if their permission meets or exceeds the required access level.

title: CONSTRUCTION MENU
desc: The Construction Menu can be expanded to switch between Placeables, Decorations and Building Sets. The chosen set will determine which buildables can be selected.
The Favorites tab is customizable and can contain up to 20 entries. It will always be visible regardless of what set is chosen.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/R> Change Set

title: ABANDONING BASES
desc: Sub-fief consoles can be <font=text_4m>destroyed remotely</> on the map. This can be done by hovering over the map marker and using the remote destruction input appearing in the tooltip.

title: SCAVENGER CAMPS
desc: Small camps can be found all over Arrakis, populated with a handful of people trying to survive.
The camps can hold <font=text_4m>Salvaged Metal</>, <font=text_4m>Fuel Cells</> and other valuable items if you are willing to fight for them.

title: MAP MARKERS
desc: Scavenger camps and other locations appear on the <font=text_4m>Map</> when discovered, while only larger locations are shown on the <font=text_4m>Compass</>. Gray markers indicate discovered locations which change color once visited.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/M> Open Map

title: MOISTURE-SEALED CAVE
desc: Moisture-Sealed <font=text_4m>Caves</> are found throughout Arrakis, their entrances are covered by waterseals that trap precious humidity inside.
An <font=text_4m>orange</> map marker indicates that these locations are sources for components used for Hydration and Gathering equipment.

title: SHIPWRECKS
desc: <font=text_4m>Shipwrecks</> are massive structures, often visible from afar due to their sheer size.
A <font=text_4m>green</> map marker indicates that components needed to create weapons and armors can be found at these locations.

title: IMPERIAL TESTING STATIONS
desc: <font=text_4m>Imperial Testing Stations</> are scattered across Arrakis.
A <font=text_4m>blue</> location marker indicates that components needed to create vehicles and other technology can be found at these locations.

title: THE INNER SIGHT
desc: Your inner sight has revealed the path, follow it to the first Trial of Aql. The Inner Sight marker will help you find your way to the next chapter of your story.
<font=text_4m>Purple</> icons mark important locations in your journey.

title: CLIMBING
desc: <font=text_4m>Climbing</> terrain and structures can help you to explore new areas or reach a vantage point.
Climbing will drain your <font=text_4m>Stamina</>.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/__:1.2:1> [Hold] + forward to attach
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/L.Ctrl:1.8:1> Release<gap=.5>

title: STAMINA
desc: <font=text_4m>Stamina</> drains while climbing.
Stamina recharges automatically unless you're <font=text_4m>Sprinting</>.

title: LOOTING
desc: The bodies of downed enemies can hold vital tools, resources, and components.
Loot the <font=text_4m>Cutteray</> and <font=text_4m>Power Pack</> from the body and equip it.

title: LIGHT ATTACKS
desc: <font=text_4m>Light attacks</> are quick. Multiple light attacks in succession will <font=text_4m>Stagger</> the target.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/LMB:1.7:1> Light Attack

title: PARRYING
desc: Time your <font=text_4m>Block</> just as the enemy attacks to land a <font=text_4m>Parry</>.
A successful parry will <font=text_4m>Stagger</> the attacker.
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/RMB:1.7:1> Parry
<color=primary_l4,icon=key/RMB:1.7:1> [Hold] Block<gap=.5>
